Real.name: scariness
Real.description: the inherent scariness of the character

Real.name: normal body vitality
Real.description: maximum body vitality of our unit

Real.name: normal shield vitality
Real.description: maximum shield vitality of our unit

Real.name: legendary body vitality
Real.description: maximum body vitality of our unit (on legendary)

Real.name: legendary shield vitality
Real.description: maximum shield vitality of our unit (on legendary)

Real.name: body recharge fraction
Real.description: fraction of body health that can be regained after damage

Real.name: soft ping threshold (with shields)
Real.description: damage necessary to trigger a soft ping when shields are up

Real.name: soft ping threshold (no shields)
Real.description: damage necessary to trigger a soft ping when shields are down

Real.name: soft ping min interrupt time
Real.description: minimum time before a soft ping can be interrupted

Real.name: hard ping threshold (with shields)
Real.description: damage necessary to trigger a hard ping when shields are up

Real.name: hard ping threshold (no shields)
Real.description: damage necessary to trigger a hard ping when shields are down

Real.name: hard ping min interrupt time
Real.description: minimum time before a hard ping can be interrupted

Real.name: current damage decay delay
Real.description: current damage begins to fall after a time delay has passed since last the damage (MAX 4.1, because timer is stored in a char so 127 ticks maximum)

Real.name: current damage decay time
Real.description: amount of time it would take for 100% current damage to decay to 0

Real.name: recent damage decay delay
Real.description: recent damage begins to fall after a time delay has passed since last the damage (MAX 4.1, because timer is stored in a char so 127 ticks maximum)

Real.name: recent damage decay time
Real.description: amount of time it would take for 100% recent damage to decay to 0

Real.name: body recharge delay time
Real.description: amount of time delay before a shield begins to recharge

Real.name: body recharge time
Real.description: amount of time for shields to recharge completely

Real.name: shield recharge delay time
Real.description: amount of time delay before a shield begins to recharge

Real.name: shield recharge time
Real.description: amount of time for shields to recharge completely

Real.name: stun threshold
Real.description: stun level that triggers the stunned state (currently, the 'stunned' behavior)

Real.name: extended shield damage threshold
Real.description: Amount of shield damage sustained before it is considered 'extended'

Real.name: extended body damage threshold
Real.description: Amount of body damage sustained before it is considered 'extended'

Real.name: suicide radius
Real.description: when I die and explode, I damage stuff within this distance of me.

Real.name: max vision distance
Real.description: maximum range of sight

Angle.name: central vision angle
Angle.description: horizontal angle within which we see targets out to our maximum range

Angle.name: max vision angle
Angle.description: maximum horizontal angle within which we see targets at range

Angle.name: peripheral vision angle
Angle.description: maximum horizontal angle within which we can see targets out of the corner of our eye

Real.name: peripheral distance
Real.description: maximum range at which we can see targets our of the corner of our eye

Real.name: hearing distance
Real.description: maximum range at which sounds can be heard

Real.name: notice projectile chance
Real.description: random chance of noticing a dangerous enemy projectile (e.g. grenade)

Real.name: notice vehicle chance
Real.description: random chance of noticing a dangerous vehicle

Real.name: combat perception time
Real.description: time required to acknowledge a visible enemy when we are already in combat or searching for them

Real.name: guard perception time
Real.description: time required to acknowledge a visible enemy when we have been alerted

Real.name: non-combat perception time
Real.description: time required to acknowledge a visible enemy when we are not alerted

Real.name: first ack. surprise distance
Real.description: If a new prop is acknowledged within the given distance, surprise is registerd

Real.name: Shield threshold
Real.description: When shield vitality drops below given amount, retreat is triggered by low_shield_retreat_impulse

Real.name: Scary target threshold
Real.description: When confronting an enemy of over the given scariness, retreat is triggered by scary_target_retreat_impulse

Real.name: Danger threshold
Real.description: When perceived danger rises above the given threshold, retreat is triggered by danger_retreat_impulse

Real.name: Proximity threshold
Real.description: When enemy closer than given threshold, retreat is triggered by proximity_retreat_impulse

RealBounds.name: min/max forced cower time bounds
RealBounds.description: actor cowers for at least the given amount of time

RealBounds.name: min/max cower timeout bounds
RealBounds.description: actor times out of cower after the given amount of time

Real.name: proximity ambush threshold
Real.description: If target reaches is within the given proximity, an ambush is triggered by the proximity ambush impulse

Real.name: awareness ambush threshold
Real.description: If target is less than threshold (0-1) aware of me, an ambush is triggered by the vulnerable enemy ambush impulse

Real.name: leader dead retreat chance
Real.description: If leader-dead-retreat-impulse is active, gives the chance that we will flee when our leader dies within 4 world units of us

Real.name: peer dead retreat chance
Real.description: If peer-dead-retreat-impulse is active, gives the chance that we will flee when one of our peers (friend of the same race) dies within 4 world units of us

Real.name: second peer dead retreat chance
Real.description: If peer-dead-retreat-impulse is active, gives the chance that we will flee when a second peer (friend of the same race) dies within 4 world units of us

Angle.name: zig-zag angle
Angle.description: The angle from the intended destination direction that a zig-zag will cause

Real.name: zig-zag period
Real.description: How long it takes to zig left and then zag right.

Real.name: retreat grenade chance
Real.description: The likelihood of throwing down a grenade to cover our retreat

TagReference.name: backup weapon
TagReference.description: If I want to flee and I don't have flee animations with my current weapon, throw it away and try a ...

RealEulerAngles2D.name: maximum aiming deviation
RealEulerAngles2D.description: how far we can turn our weapon

RealEulerAngles2D.name: maximum looking deviation
RealEulerAngles2D.description: how far we can turn our head

Angle.name: noncombat look delta L
Angle.description: how far we can turn our head left away from our aiming vector when not in combat

Angle.name: noncombat look delta R
Angle.description: how far we can turn our head right away from our aiming vector when not in combat

Angle.name: combat look delta L
Angle.description: how far we can turn our head left away from our aiming vector when in combat

Angle.name: combat look delta R
Angle.description: how far we can turn our head right away from our aiming vector when in combat

RealBounds.name: noncombat idle looking
RealBounds.description: rate at which we change look around randomly when not in combat

RealBounds.name: noncombat idle aiming
RealBounds.description: rate at which we change aiming directions when looking around randomly when not in combat

RealBounds.name: combat idle looking
RealBounds.description: rate at which we change look around randomly when searching or in combat

RealBounds.name: combat idle aiming
RealBounds.description: rate at which we change aiming directions when looking around randomly when searching or in combat

Real.name: Crouch danger threshold
Real.description: When danger rises above the threshold, the actor crouches

Real.name: Stand danger threshold
Real.description: When danger drops below this threshold, the actor can stand again.

Real.name: Fight danger move threshold
Real.description: When danger goes above given level, this actor switches firing positions

Explanation.name: Danger Values
Explanation.description: Danger values can be found in the ai-globals section of the globals tag.

Real.name: Evasion danger threshold
Real.description: Consider evading when immediate danger surpasses threshold

Real.name: Evasion delay timer
Real.description: Wait at least this delay between evasions

Real.name: Evasion chance
Real.description: If danger is above threshold, the chance that we will evade. Expressed as chance of evading within a 1 second time period

Real.name: Evasion proximity threshold
Real.description: If target is within given proximity, possibly evade

Real.name: dive retreat chance
Real.description: Chance of retreating (fleeing) after danger avoidance dive

RealBounds.name: hide behind cover time
RealBounds.description: how long we stay behind cover after seeking cover

Real.name: Cover vitality threshold
Real.description: When vitality drops below this level, possibly trigger a cover

Real.name: Cover shield fraction
Real.description: trigger cover when shield drops below this fraction (low shield cover impulse must be enabled)

Real.name: Cover check delay
Real.description: amount of time I will wait before trying again after covering

Real.name: Emerge from cover when shield fraction reaches threshold
Real.description: Emerge from cover when shield fraction reaches threshold

Real.name: Cover danger threshold
Real.description: Danger must be this high to cover. At a danger level of 'danger threshold', the chance of seeking cover is the cover chance lower bound (below)

Real.name: Danger upper threshold
Real.description: At or above danger level of upper threshold, the chance of seeking cover is the cover chance upper bound (below)

Explanation.name: Cover chance
Explanation.description: The Bounds on the chance of seeking cover. The lower bound is valid when the danger is at 'danger threshold' The upper bound is valid when the danger is at or above 'danger upper threshold'. It is interpolated linearly everywhere in between. All chances are expressed as 'chance of triggering cover in a 1 second period'.

RealBounds.name: Cover chance
RealBounds.description: Bounds on the chances of seeking cover.

Real.name: Proximity self-preserve
Real.description: When the proximity_self_preservation impulse is enabled, triggers self-preservation when target within this distance

Real.name: Disallow cover distance
Real.description: Disallow covering from visible target under the given distance away

Real.name: proximity melee distance
Real.description: When self preserving from a target less than given distance, causes melee attack (assuming proximity_melee_impulse is enabled)

Real.name: unreachable enemy danger threshold
Real.description: When danger from an unreachable enemy surpasses threshold, actor cover (assuming unreachable_enemy_cover impulse is enabled)

Real.name: scary target threshold
Real.description: When target is aware of me and surpasses the given scariness, self-preserve (assuming scary_target_cover_impulse is enabled)

RealBounds.name: Uncover distance bounds
RealBounds.description: Distance of uncover point from target. Hard lower limit, soft upper limit.

RealBounds.name: Min/Max pre-search bounds
RealBounds.description: If the min presearch time expires and the target is (actually) outside the min-certainty radius, presearch turns off

RealBounds.name: min presearch time
RealBounds.description: If the min presearch time expires and the target is (actually) outside the min-certainty radius, presearch turns off

RealBounds.name: max presearch time
RealBounds.description: Presearch turns off after the given time

RealBounds.name: min suppressing time
RealBounds.description: if the min suppressing time expires and the target is outside the min-certainty radius, suppressing fire turns off

Real.name: maximum firing distance
Real.description: we can only fire our weapon at targets within this distance

Real.name: rate of fire
Real.description: how many times per second we pull the trigger (zero = continuously held down)

Angle.name: projectile error
Angle.description: error added to every projectile we fire

RealVector3D.name: custom stand gun offset
RealVector3D.description: custom standing gun offset for overriding the default in the base actor

RealVector3D.name: custom crouch gun offset
RealVector3D.description: custom crouching gun offset for overriding the default in the base actor

Real.name: target tracking
Real.description: how well our bursts track moving targets. 0.0= fire at the position they were standing when we started the burst. 1.0= fire at current position

Real.name: target leading
Real.description: how much we lead moving targets. 0.0= no prediction. 1.0= predict completely.

Real.name: weapon damage modifier
Real.description: what fraction of its normal damage our weapon inflicts (zero = no modifier)

Real.name: minimum firing range
Real.description: weapon will not be fired at target closer than given distance

Explanation.name: burst geometry
Explanation.description:
at the start of every burst we pick a random point near the target to fire at, on either the left or the right side. the burst origin angle controls whether this error is exactly horizontal or might have some vertical component.
over the course of the burst we move our projectiles back in the opposite direction towards the target. this return motion is also controlled by an angle that specifies how close to the horizontal it is.
for example if the burst origin angle and the burst return angle were both zero, and the return length was the same as the burst length, every burst would start the same amount away from the target (on either the left or right) and move back to exactly over the target at the end of the burst.

Real.name: burst origin radius
Real.description: how far away from the target the starting point is

Angle.name: burst origin angle
Angle.description: the range from the horizontal that our starting error can be

RealBounds.name: burst return length
RealBounds.description: how far the burst point moves back towards the target (could be negative)

Angle.name: burst return angle
Angle.description: the range from the horizontal that the return direction can be

RealBounds.name: burst duration
RealBounds.description: how long each burst we fire is

RealBounds.name: burst separation
RealBounds.description: how long we wait between bursts

Angle.name: burst angular velocity
Angle.description: the maximum rate at which we can sweep our fire (zero = unlimited)

Real.name: special damage modifier
Real.description: damage modifier for special weapon fire (applied in addition to the normal damage modifier. zero = no change)

Angle.name: special projectile error
Angle.description: projectile error angle for special weapon fire (applied in addition to the normal error)

Real.name: super-ballistic range
Real.description: we try to aim our shots super-ballistically if target is outside this range (zero = never)

Real.name: bombardment range
Real.description: we offset our burst targets randomly by this range when firing at non-visible enemies (zero = never)

ShortEnum.name: special-fire mode
ShortEnum.description: the type of special weapon fire that we can use

ShortEnum.name: special-fire situation
ShortEnum.description: when we will decide to use our special weapon fire mode

Real.name: special-fire chance
Real.description: how likely we are to use our special weapon fire mode

Real.name: special-fire delay
Real.description: how long we must wait between uses of our special weapon fire mode

RealBounds.name: drop weapon loaded
RealBounds.description: amount of ammo loaded into the weapon that we drop (in fractions of a clip, e.g. 0.3 to 0.5)

ShortBounds.name: drop weapon ammo
ShortBounds.description: total number of rounds in the weapon that we drop (ignored for energy weapons)

Real.name: Max special target distance
Real.description: Specific target regions on a vehicle or unit will be fired upon only under the given distance

RealBounds.name: Ballistic firing bounds
RealBounds.description: At the min range, the min ballistic fraction is used, at the max, the max ballistic fraction is used

RealBounds.name: Ballistic fraction bounds
RealBounds.description: Controls speed and degree of arc. 0 = high, slow, 1 = low, fast

Real.name: maximum firing range
Real.description: we can only fire our weapon at targets within this distance

Real.name: minimum firing range
Real.description: weapon will not be fired at target closer than given distance

Real.name: bombardment range
Real.description: we offset our burst targets randomly by this range when firing at non-visible enemies (zero = never)

Real.name: Max special target distance
Real.description: Specific target regions on a vehicle or unit will be fired upon only under the given distance

Real.name: super-ballistic range
Real.description: we try to aim our shots super-ballistically if target is outside this range (zero = never)

RealBounds.name: Ballistic firing bounds
RealBounds.description: At the min range, the min ballistic fraction is used, at the max, the max ballistic fraction is used

RealBounds.name: Ballistic fraction bounds
RealBounds.description: Controls speed and degree of arc. 0 = high, slow, 1 = low, fast

RealVector3D.name: custom stand gun offset
RealVector3D.description: custom standing gun offset for overriding the default in the base actor

RealVector3D.name: custom crouch gun offset
RealVector3D.description: custom crouching gun offset for overriding the default in the base actor

ShortEnum.name: special-fire mode
ShortEnum.description: the type of special weapon fire that we can use

ShortEnum.name: special-fire situation
ShortEnum.description: when we will decide to use our special weapon fire mode

Real.name: special-fire chance
Real.description: how likely we are to use our special weapon fire mode

Real.name: special-fire delay
Real.description: how long we must wait between uses of our special weapon fire mode

Real.name: special damage modifier
Real.description: damage modifier for special weapon fire (applied in addition to the normal damage modifier. zero = no change)

Angle.name: special projectile error
Angle.description: projectile error angle for special weapon fire (applied in addition to the normal error)

RealBounds.name: drop weapon loaded
RealBounds.description: amount of ammo loaded into the weapon that we drop (in fractions of a clip, e.g. 0.3 to 0.5)

ShortBounds.name: drop weapon ammo
ShortBounds.description: total number of rounds in the weapon that we drop (ignored for energy weapons)

Explanation.name: Accuracy
Explanation.description: Parameters control how accuracy changes over the duration of a series of bursts Accuracy is an analog value between 0 and 1. At zero, the parameters of the first firing-pattern block is used. At 1, the parameters in the second block is used. In between, all the values are linearly interpolated

RealBounds.name: normal accuracy bounds
RealBounds.description: Indicates starting and ending accuracies at normal difficulty

Real.name: normal accuracy time
Real.description: The amount of time it takes the accuracy to go from starting to ending

RealBounds.name: heroic accuracy bounds
RealBounds.description: Indicates starting and ending accuracies at heroic difficulty

Real.name: heroic accuracy time
Real.description: The amount of time it takes the accuracy to go from starting to ending

RealBounds.name: legendary accuracy bounds
RealBounds.description: Indicates starting and ending accuracies at legendary difficulty

Real.name: legendary accuracy time
Real.description: The amount of time it takes the accuracy to go from starting to ending

Real.name: rate of fire
Real.description: how many times per second we pull the trigger (zero = continuously held down)

Real.name: target tracking
Real.description: how well our bursts track moving targets. 0.0= fire at the position they were standing when we started the burst. 1.0= fire at current position

Real.name: target leading
Real.description: how much we lead moving targets. 0.0= no prediction. 1.0= predict completely.

Explanation.name: burst geometry
Explanation.description:
at the start of every burst we pick a random point near the target to fire at, on either the left or the right side. the burst origin angle controls whether this error is exactly horizontal or might have some vertical component.
over the course of the burst we move our projectiles back in the opposite direction towards the target. this return motion is also controlled by an angle that specifies how close to the horizontal it is.
for example if the burst origin angle and the burst return angle were both zero, and the return length was the same as the burst length, every burst would start the same amount away from the target (on either the left or right) and move back to exactly over the target at the end of the burst.

Real.name: burst origin radius
Real.description: how far away from the target the starting point is

Angle.name: burst origin angle
Angle.description: the range from the horizontal that our starting error can be

RealBounds.name: burst return length
RealBounds.description: how far the burst point moves back towards the target (could be negative)

Angle.name: burst return angle
Angle.description: the range from the horizontal that the return direction can be

RealBounds.name: burst duration
RealBounds.description: how long each burst we fire is

RealBounds.name: burst separation
RealBounds.description: how long we wait between bursts

Real.name: weapon damage modifier
Real.description: what fraction of its normal damage our weapon inflicts (zero = no modifier)

Angle.name: projectile error
Angle.description: error added to every projectile we fire

Angle.name: burst angular velocity
Angle.description: the maximum rate at which we can sweep our fire (zero = unlimited)

Angle.name: maximum error angle
Angle.description: cap on the maximum angle by which we will miss target (restriction on burst origin radius

ShortEnum.name: grenade type
ShortEnum.description: type of grenades that we throw^

ShortInteger.name: minimum enemy count
ShortInteger.description: how many enemies must be within the radius of the grenade before we will consider throwing there

Real.name: enemy radius
Real.description: we consider enemies within this radius when determining where to throw

Real.name: grenade ideal velocity
Real.description: how fast we LIKE to throw our grenades

Real.name: grenade velocity
Real.description: the fastest we can possibly throw our grenades

RealBounds.name: grenade ranges
RealBounds.description: ranges within which we will consider throwing a grenade

Real.name: collateral damage radius
Real.description: we won't throw if there are friendlies around our target within this range

RealFraction.name: grenade chance
RealFraction.description: how likely we are to throw a grenade in one second

Real.name: grenade throw delay
Real.description: How long we have to wait after throwing a grenade before we can throw another one

RealFraction.name: grenade uncover chance
RealFraction.description: how likely we are to throw a grenade to flush out a target in one second

RealFraction.name: anti-vehicle grenade chance
RealFraction.description: how likely we are to throw a grenade against a vehicle

ShortBounds.name: grenade count
ShortBounds.description: number of grenades that we start with

Real.name: dont drop grenades chance
Real.description: how likely we are not to drop any grenades when we die, even if we still have some

Real.name: melee attack timeout
Real.description: Give up after given amount of time spent charging

Real.name: melee attack timeout
Real.description: Give up after given amount of time spent charging

Real.name: melee attack timeout
Real.description: Give up after given amount of time spent charging

Real.name: melee chance
Real.description: chance of initiating a melee within a 1 second period

Real.name: melee attack timeout
Real.description: Give up after given amount of time spent charging

Real.name: melee attack delay timer
Real.description: don't attempt again before given time since last melee

Real.name: melee delay timer
Real.description: time between melee leaps

TagReference.name: berserk weapon
TagReference.description: when I berserk, I pull out a ...

RealBounds.name: ready time bounds
RealBounds.description: Character will pause for given time before engaging threat

Real.name: ai pathfinding radius
Real.description: (Ground vehicles)

Real.name: ai destination radius
Real.description: (All vehicles) Distance within which goal is considered reached

Real.name: ai deceleration distance
Real.description: (All vehicles)Distance from goal at which AI starts to decelerate

Real.name: ai turning radius
Real.description: (Warthog, Pelican) Idealized average turning radius (should reflect actual vehicle physics)

Real.name: ai inner turning radius (< tr)
Real.description: (Warthog-type) Idealized minimum turning radius (should reflect actual vehicle physics)

Real.name: ai ideal turning radius (> tr)
Real.description: (Warthogs, ghosts) Ideal turning radius for rounding turns (barring obstacles, etc.)

Real.name: ai max steering angle
Real.description: (Warthog, ghosts, wraiths)Maximum steering angle from forward (ultimately controls turning speed)

Real.name: ai max steering delta
Real.description: (pelicans, dropships, ghosts, wraiths)Maximum delta in steering angle from one tick to the next (ultimately controls turn acceleration)

Real.name: ai oversteering scale
Real.description: (Warthog, ghosts, wraiths)

AngleBounds.name: ai oversteering bounds
AngleBounds.description: (Banshee) Angle to goal at which AI will oversteer

Real.name: ai sideslip distance
Real.description: (Ghosts, Dropships) Distance within which AI will strafe to target (as opposed to turning)

Real.name: ai throttle maximum
Real.description: (All vehicles)

Real.name: ai goal min throttle scale
Real.description: (Warthogs, Dropships, ghosts)scale on throttle when within 'ai deceleration distance' of goal (0...1)

Real.name: ai turn min throttle scale
Real.description: (Warthogs, ghosts) Scale on throttle due to nearness to a turn (0...1)

Real.name: ai direction min throttle scale
Real.description: (Warthogs, ghosts) Scale on throttle due to facing away from intended direction (0...1)

Real.name: ai acceleration scale
Real.description: (warthogs, ghosts) The maximum allowable change in throttle between ticks

Real.name: ai charge repeat timeout
Real.description: (All vehicles) Time delay between vehicle charges

Real.name: DEPRECATED (ai strafing abort range)
Real.description: (All vehicles) Distance at which charge will be aborted!

Real.name: ai avoidance distance
Real.description: (Banshee, Sentinels, Dropships) Look-ahead distance for obstacle avoidance

Real.name: ai charge look-ahead time
Real.description: (All vehicles) In deciding when to abort vehicle charge, look ahead these many seconds to predict time of contact

Real.name: ai cover min distance
Real.description: (All vehicles) When executing vehicle-cover, minimum distance from the target to flee to

Real.name: ai cover time
Real.description: (All vehicles) How long to stay away from the target

Real.name: ai charge consider distance
Real.description: Consider charging the target when it is within this range (0 = infinite distance)

Real.name: ai charge abort distance
Real.description: Abort the charge when the target get more than this far away (0 = never abort)

Real.name: ai destination radius
Real.description: Distance within which goal is considered reached

Real.name: ai deceleration distance
Real.description: Distance from goal at which AI starts to decelerate

Real.name: ai turning radius
Real.description: Idealized average turning radius (should reflect actual vehicle physics)

Real.name: ai inner turning radius (< tr)
Real.description: Idealized minimum turning radius (should reflect actual vehicle physics)

Real.name: ai ideal turning radius (> tr)
Real.description: Ideal turning radius for rounding turns (barring obstacles, etc.)

Real.name: ai max steering angle
Real.description: Maximum steering angle from forward (ultimately controls turning speed)

Real.name: ai max steering delta
Real.description: Maximum delta in steering angle from one tick to the next (ultimately controls turn acceleration)

AngleBounds.name: ai oversteering bounds
AngleBounds.description: Angle to goal at which AI will oversteer

Real.name: ai sideslip distance
Real.description: Distance within which AI will strafe to target (as opposed to turning)

Real.name: ai avoidance distance
Real.description: Look-ahead distance for obstacle avoidance

Real.name: ai min urgency
Real.description: The minimum urgency with which a turn can be made (urgency = percent of maximum steering delta)

Real.name: ai goal min throttle scale
Real.description: scale on throttle when within 'ai deceleration distance' of goal (0...1)

Real.name: ai turn min throttle scale
Real.description: Scale on throttle due to nearness to a turn (0...1)

Real.name: ai direction min throttle scale
Real.description: Scale on throttle due to facing away from intended direction (0...1)

Real.name: ai acceleration scale
Real.description: The maximum allowable change in throttle between ticks

Real.name: ai throttle blend
Real.description: The degree of throttle blending between one tick and the next (0 = no blending)

Real.name: theoretical max speed
Real.description: About how fast I can go.

Real.name: error scale
Real.description: scale on the difference between desired and actual speed, applied to throttle

Real.name: ai charge tight angle distance
Real.description: The distance at which the tight angle criterion is used for deciding to vehicle charge

Real.name: ai charge tight angle
Real.description: Angle cosine within which the target must be when target is closer than tight angle distance in order to charge

Real.name: ai charge repeat timeout
Real.description: Time delay between vehicle charges

Real.name: ai charge look-ahead time
Real.description: In deciding when to abort vehicle charge, look ahead these many seconds to predict time of contact

Real.name: ai charge consider distance
Real.description: Consider charging the target when it is within this range (0 = infinite distance)

Real.name: ai charge abort distance
Real.description: Abort the charge when the target get more than this far away (0 = never abort)

Real.name: vehicle ram timeout
Real.description: The ram behavior stops after a maximum of the given number of seconds

Real.name: ram paralysis time
Real.description: The ram behavior freezes the vehicle for a given number of seconds after performing the ram

Real.name: ai cover damage threshold
Real.description: Trigger a cover when recent damage is above given threshold (damage_vehicle_cover impulse)

Real.name: ai cover min distance
Real.description: When executing vehicle-cover, minimum distance from the target to flee to

Real.name: ai cover time
Real.description: How long to stay away from the target

Real.name: ai cover min boost distance
Real.description: Boosting allowed when distance to cover destination is greater then this.

Real.name: turtling recent damage threshold
Real.description: If vehicle turtling behavior is enabled, turtling is initiated if 'recent damage' surpasses the given threshold

Real.name: turtling min time
Real.description: If the vehicle turtling behavior is enabled, turtling occurs for at least the given time

Real.name: turtling timeout
Real.description: The turtled state times out after the given number of seconds

RealBounds.name: idle pose delay time
RealBounds.description: time range for delays between idle poses

TagReference.name: creature
TagReference.description: Creature reference for swarm characters ONLY

ShortInteger.name: scatter killed count
ShortInteger.description: After the given number of deaths, the swarm scatters

Real.name: scatter radius
Real.description: the distance from the target that the swarm scatters

Real.name: scatter time
Real.description: amount of time to remain scattered

Real.name: perlin offset scale
Real.description: amount of randomness added to creature's throttle

RealBounds.name: offset period
RealBounds.description: how fast the creature changes random offset to throttle

Real.name: perlin idle movement threshold
Real.description: a random offset lower then given threshold is made 0. (threshold of 1 = no movement)

Real.name: perlin combat movement threshold
Real.description: a random offset lower then given threshold is made 0. (threshold of 1 = no movement)

Explanation.name: Danger Values
Explanation.description: Danger values can be found in the ai-globals section of the globals tag.

Real.name: look comment time
Real.description: How long does the player look at an AI before the AI responds?

Real.name: look long comment time
Real.description: How long does the player look at the AI before he responds with his 'long look' comment?

TagReference.name: creature
TagReference.description: Creature reference for swarm characters ONLY

Explanation.name: Danger Values
Explanation.description: Danger values can be found in the ai-globals section of the globals tag.

Real.name: max distance
Real.description: maximum distance from entry point that we will consider boarding

Real.name: abort distance
Real.description: give up trying to get in boarding seat if entry point is further away than this

Real.name: max speed
Real.description: maximum speed at which we will consider boarding

Real.name: flurry damage threshold
Real.description: when more than x damage is caused a juggernaut flurry is triggered

Real.name: flurry time
Real.description: flurry lasts this long
